info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 07 at 3:00AM PST until December 07 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON ABOVE 3500 FEET... * WHAT...Snow above 3500 feet. Additional snow accumulations of 5 to 7 inches for eastern Siskiyou County and 8 to 10 inches across the high terrain of western Siskiyou County generally above 4500 feet and above 5500 feet in the Mt Shasta area. * WHERE...Portions of Siskiyou County above 3500 ft. This includes the higher terrain of the Salmon Mountains, Mt Shasta Ski Park, and the Medicine Lake area south of Tennant, as well as portions of Sawyers Bar Rd and Etna Summit. * WHEN...Until 4 PM PST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...There is a 70-90% of snowfall rates reaching 1 inch/hr this morning into early afternoon, with the highest rates from a little before sunrise into mid to late morning today.. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See http://quickmap.dot.ca.gov for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
